stories.text: Hi, I am testing a product idea, that allows reaching out to hundreds thousands of developers (potentially millions) and I need early customers. You can be a product company that makes developer tools or have a product targeting developers. If you are interested, reach out me on Twitter https://twitter.com/nurlannurmanov
stories.title: Ask HN: Reaching Out to Millions of Developers

stories.text: I'm working in a Cryptocurrency startup, and all my colleagues are investing heavily into the domain, both mentally and monetarily. I cannot shake off the feeling that this is all a scam. It's so shady, from the way there are new coins and tokens every week, and how investors are throwing money into this program. I don't think my company's product deserves the sort of money it's been getting, and it feels like a bubble that will burst, sooner if not later. Some part of the tech is interesting, the essence of the blockchain, for example, but the main application seems to be just suspicious. What do others in the domain think? I'm not leaving yet because I'm not in a place to change jobs yet again, but I will, eventually, but I feel like this domain is very fishy.
stories.title: Ask HN: Does Anyone else working in a crypto company feel this is all a scam?
